name: tcksift2
description:
Optimise per-streamline cross-section multipliers to match a whole-brain tractogram to fixel-wise fibre densities.



References:

Smith, R. E.; Tournier, J.-D.; Calamante, F. & Connelly, A. SIFT2: Enabling dense quantitative assessment of brain white matter connectivity using streamlines tractography. NeuroImage, 2015, 119, 338-351

* If using the -linear option: 
Smith, RE; Raffelt, D; Tournier, J-D; Connelly, A. Quantitative Streamlines Tractography: Methods and Inter-Subject Normalisation. Open Science Framework, https://doi.org/10.31219/osf.io/c67kn.
author: Robert E. Smith (robert.smith@florey.edu.au)

inputs.name: in_tracks
inputs.description: the input track file

inputs.name: in_fod
inputs.description: input image containing the spherical harmonics of the fibre orientation distributions

inputs.name: out_weights
inputs.description: output text file containing the weighting factor for each streamline

inputs.name: proc_mask
inputs.description: provide an image containing the processing mask weights for the model; image spatial dimensions must match the fixel image

inputs.name: act
inputs.description: use an ACT five-tissue-type segmented anatomical image to derive the processing mask

inputs.name: fd_scale_gm
inputs.description: provide this option (in conjunction with -act) to heuristically downsize the fibre density estimates based on the presence of GM in the voxel. This can assist in reducing tissue interface effects when using a single-tissue deconvolution algorithm

inputs.name: no_dilate_lut
inputs.description: do NOT dilate FOD lobe lookup tables; only map streamlines to FOD lobes if the precise tangent lies within the angular spread of that lobe

inputs.name: make_null_lobes
inputs.description: add an additional FOD lobe to each voxel, with zero integral, that covers all directions with zero / negative FOD amplitudes

inputs.name: remove_untracked
inputs.description: remove FOD lobes that do not have any streamline density attributed to them; this improves filtering slightly, at the expense of longer computation time (and you can no longer do quantitative comparisons between reconstructions if this is enabled)

inputs.name: fd_thresh
inputs.description: fibre density threshold; exclude an FOD lobe from filtering processing if its integral is less than this amount (streamlines will still be mapped to it, but it will not contribute to the cost function or the filtering)

inputs.name: csv
inputs.description: output statistics of execution per iteration to a .csv file

inputs.name: out_mu
inputs.description: output the final value of SIFT proportionality coefficient mu to a text file

inputs.name: output_debug
inputs.description: provide various output images for assessing & debugging performance etc.

inputs.name: out_coeffs
inputs.description: output text file containing the weighting coefficient for each streamline

inputs.name: reg_tikhonov
inputs.description: provide coefficient for regularising streamline weighting coefficients (Tikhonov regularisation) (default: 0)

inputs.name: reg_tv
inputs.description: provide coefficient for regularising variance of streamline weighting coefficient to fixels along its length (Total Variation regularisation) (default: 0.1)

inputs.name: min_td_frac
inputs.description: minimum fraction of the FOD integral reconstructed by streamlines; if the reconstructed streamline density is below this fraction, the fixel is excluded from optimisation (default: 0.1)

inputs.name: min_iters
inputs.description: minimum number of iterations to run before testing for convergence; this can prevent premature termination at early iterations if the cost function increases slightly (default: 10)

inputs.name: max_iters
inputs.description: maximum number of iterations to run before terminating program

inputs.name: min_factor
inputs.description: minimum weighting factor for an individual streamline; if the factor falls below this number the streamline will be rejected entirely (factor set to zero) (default: 0)

inputs.name: min_coeff
inputs.description: minimum weighting coefficient for an individual streamline; similar to the '-min_factor' option, but using the exponential coefficient basis of the SIFT2 model; these parameters are related as: factor = e^(coeff). Note that the -min_factor and -min_coeff options are mutually exclusive - you can only provide one. (default: -inf)

inputs.name: max_factor
inputs.description: maximum weighting factor that can be assigned to any one streamline (default: inf)

inputs.name: max_coeff
inputs.description: maximum weighting coefficient for an individual streamline; similar to the '-max_factor' option, but using the exponential coefficient basis of the SIFT2 model; these parameters are related as: factor = e^(coeff). Note that the -max_factor and -max_coeff options are mutually exclusive - you can only provide one. (default: inf)

inputs.name: max_coeff_step
inputs.description: maximum change to a streamline's weighting coefficient in a single iteration (default: 1)

inputs.name: min_cf_decrease
inputs.description: minimum decrease in the cost function (as a fraction of the initial value) that must occur each iteration for the algorithm to continue (default: 2.5e-05)

inputs.name: linear
inputs.description: perform a linear estimation of streamline weights, rather than the standard non-linear optimisation (typically does not provide as accurate a model fit; but only requires a single pass)

inputs.name: info
inputs.description: display information messages.

inputs.name: quiet
inputs.description: do not display information messages or progress status; alternatively, this can be achieved by setting the MRTRIX_QUIET environment variable to a non-empty string.

inputs.name: debug
inputs.description: display debugging messages.

inputs.name: force
inputs.description: force overwrite of output files (caution: using the same file as input and output might cause unexpected behaviour).

inputs.name: nthreads
inputs.description: use this number of threads in multi-threaded applications (set to 0 to disable multi-threading).

inputs.name: config
inputs.description: temporarily set the value of an MRtrix config file entry.

type.name: config
type.description: temporarily set the value of an MRtrix config file entry.

inputs.name: key
inputs.description: temporarily set the value of an MRtrix config file entry.

inputs.name: value
inputs.description: temporarily set the value of an MRtrix config file entry.

inputs.name: help
inputs.description: display this information page and exit.

inputs.name: version
inputs.description: display version information and exit.
